qas.question: What was the windmill used for?
which crops were brought to europe from the Muslim World?
Trading in the Indian ocean was mainly controlled by whom?
When did the Portuguese arrive in the Indian Ocean?
Where was an important center of Indian Ocean trading in the 16th century?
What technology was developed from advances in irrigation and farming?
What crops were brought from Europe?
What cultivation was gradually adopted by Muslims>
Where did Arab merchants dominate after the 16th century?
Who arrived in the Indian Ocean in the 1600's

context: Advances were made in <a0_0>irrigation and farming<a0_0/>, using new technology such as <b5_0>the windmill<b5_0/>. Crops such as <a1_0><b6_0>almonds and citrus fruit<b6_0/><a1_0/> were brought to Europe through al-Andalus, and <b7_0>sugar<b7_0/> cultivation was gradually adopted by the Europeans. <a2_0>Arab merchants<a2_0/> dominated trade in the <b8_0>Indian Ocean<b8_0/> until the arrival of the <b9_0>Portuguese<b9_0/> in the <a3_0>16th century<a3_0/>. <a4_0>Hormuz<a4_0/> was an important center for this trade. There was also a dense network of trade routes in the Mediterranean, along which Muslim countries traded with each other and with European powers such as Venice, Genoa and Catalonia. The Silk Road crossing Central Asia passed through Muslim states between China and Europe.
